title: Missing management engine
message:
[SIZE=14px][B]820-3476 [/B][/SIZE]


Hi.

[U][B]History[/B][/U]
This is a recycling centre machine, already worked on.
Was no power
Replaced Q7130 and some other badly done bit's I can't remember.

[U][B]Problem[/B][/U]
Board now powers, hangs on boot.
Fans running high.
ASD (EFI) says management engine missing, Ts0P error but Ts0P returns nothing on the schematic

This is SPI ROM issue right?

title: Missing management engine
message:
Here BIOS with clean ME, that should fix ME issue.
[URL="https://drive.google.com/open?id=0ByfhQ_x0v-tZNW04UTlOUnB6bms"]https://drive.google.com/open?id=0By...W04UTlOUnB6bms[/URL]

TS0P is sensor in the trackpad, check flat cable/connector.

title: Missing management engine
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 8703"]Here BIOS with clean ME, that should fix ME issue.
[URL="https://drive.google.com/open?id=0ByfhQ_x0v-tZNW04UTlOUnB6bms"]https://drive.google.com/open?id=0By...W04UTlOUnB6bms[/URL]

TS0P is sensor in the trackpad, check flat cable/connector.[/QUOTE]

Ideal, thank you. There a good tool for flashing BIOS?.... I'll use the google but anyone want to share info on what they use would be appreciated.

Thanks

title: Missing management engine
message: EZP2010 or TL866 and some adapters from SOIC to DIP

title: Missing management engine
message:
HI.
If I go ahead and flash with clean ME will I also need to re-serializer the board?

title: Missing management engine
message: If you want you can search the file for "SSN" or "ssn" and change the serial in a HEX editor.

title: Missing management engine
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 9205"]If you want you can search the file for "SSN" or "ssn" and change the serial in a HEX editor.[/QUOTE]

OK thanks. I'll find a hex editor for OS X.

Also, let's say hypothetically that I get a board in with a shorted CPU high side and I want to replace the board. If read the chip, search for SSN, I can then change the serial on the new board to the one on the MacBook base right?

title: Missing management engine
message: Why risk messing things up, who cares about the serial #.

title: Missing management engine
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 9212"]Why risk messing things up, who cares about the serial #.[/QUOTE]

Good point.

EDIT. Though I have had customers complain!
